docs.title: Welcome to (incomplete) list of Swiss German NLP resources
docs.text:
Here’s an incomplete list of Swiss German NLP goodies to help you dive right in!

For full documentation visit mkdocs.org.

docs.title: Commands
docs.text:
• mkdocs new [dir-name] - Create a new project.
  • mkdocs serve - Start the live-reloading docs server.
  • mkdocs build - Build the documentation site.
  • mkdocs -h - Print help message and exit.

docs.title: Project layout
docs.text:
mkdocs.yml    # The configuration file.
docs/
    index.md  # The documentation homepage.
    ...       # Other markdown pages, images and other files.

docs.title: GSW Speech + DE-CH Text
docs.text: Name Publication Size Info Availability SDS-200 Plüss et al., 2022 200h A large-scale corpus containing Swiss German texts Link Swiss Parliaments Corpus (SPC) 2019 A collection of Swiss German texts from various dialects Link STT4SG-350 Plüss et al., 2023 343h Speech corpus with recordings from multiple Swiss German dialects Link

docs.title: GSW Speech + GSW Text
docs.text: Name Publication Size Info Availability ArchiMob Samardžić et al., 2016 34 recordings, 1-2h each with on average 15540 token Oral history interviews Link SwissDial [Dogan-Sch ̈onberger et al., 2021) Parallel corpus of spoken Swiss German across 8 major dialects (AG, BE, BS, GR, LU, SG, VS, ZH) Link Patzek 2020 10 hours Speech corpus with recordings from multiple Swiss German dialects Link ... 2022 Link ... 2022 Link

docs.title: Swiss German Text Corpora
docs.text: Name Publication Size Info Availability SwissCrawl Linder et al., 2020 562,524 sentences Automatically collected from the Alemannic Wikipedia and web crawls Link creative commons, non-commercial usages Schweizerdeutsches Mundartkorpus (CHMK) Weibel & Peter, 2020 ~35 million token Dialect literature from 19th, 20th to 21st century in various dialects Link available for research "What's up, Switzerland?" Corpus Stark & Ueberwasser, 2017 763’644 WhatsApp messages, of which 506,984 in gsw WhatsApp chat messages in Swiss German dialect, non-dialectal German, French, Italian and Romansh. Link available for academic, non-commercial research NOAH's Corpus Hollenstein & Aepli, 2014 73,616 tokens Composed of Alemmanic Wikipedia, newspaper "Blick am Abend", annual report of Swatch, novels by Viktor Schobinger, blogs Link creative commons, non-commercial usages sms4science List of Publications 25'947 SMS (~650'000 tokens), 41% of which in gsw SMS messages sent in by the public, including Swiss German, non-dialectal German, French, Italian and Romansh SMS Link creative commons, non-commercial usages Alemannic Wikipedia - 31,085 articles (as of 26.04.2025) Articles written in Alemannic dialects, including Swiss German. Link freely available
